titles.title: A bill to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to acquire land in Frederick County, Maryland, for the Historic Preservation Training Center of the National Park Service, and for other purposes.
Frederick Jobs and Historic Preservation Training Center Land Acquisition Act
Frederick Jobs and Historic Preservation Training Center Land Acquisition Act
Frederick Jobs and Historic Preservation Training Center Land Acquisition Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Manchin without amendment. With written report No. 117-167.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 509.

bill.summary:
Frederick Jobs and Historic Preservation Training Center Land Acquisition Act
This bill authorizes the National Park Service (NPS) to acquire land or interests in land in Frederick County, Maryland, for the Historic Preservation Training Center and related facilities.
The NPS may acquire not more than 20 acres in the county to support the physical space, program initiatives, and workforce development capacity of the center.
The NPS may acquire land or an interest in land by donation, transfer, exchange, or purchase from a willing seller using donated or appropriated funds.
